title: When Flavor Flav referred to 'cold medina' in songs like 'Cold Lampin' with Flavor', did he mean the same thing Tone Loc did in 'Funky Cold Medina' - Quora

response.answer_text: According to Flavor Flav himself, he was the original creator of the term "Cold Medina": http://blogs.laweekly.com/westcoastsound/2011/06/flavor_flav_grammy_museum.php?page=2  It was a term he had used in conversation and on record (specifically 1988's It Takes A Nation Of Millions To Hold Us Back).  The article specifically addresses the term "cold medina", with Flav recounting a conversation between himself and Tone Loc:   "Tone Loc, one day, said, 'Yo Flav, what's "Cold Medina" man?' I said, 'It means cold pumpin', no slumpin', it's the bag you wanna be jumpin.' I said, 'Yo, you should use that in one of your records, man, I'm tellin' you.'" And Flav has claimed credit for the popular term ever since.
